articles.title: Global Myopia Crisis: 1 in 3 Kids Now Near-Sighted - SciTechDaily
articles.description: The condition currently impacts an estimated one-third of children and adolescents worldwide. Key influencing factors include female gender, residence in East Asia or urban areas, and educational level. Approximately one-third of children and teenagers worldw…
articles.content: Global myopia prevalence in children and teens has tripled since 1990 and is projected to reach 40% by 2050, with factors like gender, urbanization, and education driving rates higher. The COVID-19 p… [+5950 chars]
